Original review.


After enjoying Sword of Asumi quite a bit I've been looking forward to buy this game hoping for some similar enjoyment.

But boy, I was completely wrong!

This game feels rushed as the plot is very shallow (so far), everything is thrown in your face without much hesitation or even creating any atmosphere.
The introduction to the girls working on that resort is so quick that you do not get any impression of them. The dialogues feel clumsy and emotionless so that you click forward hoping that the next screen will bring that 'Wow!' effect, but unfortunately, it won't happen.

The other downside is the very bad spelling/grammar throughout the text. It is riddled with spelling mistakes.
Don't get me wrong, I am used to VNs with some spelling mistakes and I do make a fair share of spelling mistakes too, but in this game there are so many of them that it's impossible (for me) to pass over them.
It seems that the text hasn't been proofread at all and that the author might not be a native speaker.

The music is quite nice, but gets repetitive soon so you want to turn it off after a while.
The art style is nice and well drawn and it features some cute girls.

I have clocked two hours into the game so I am at the limit for asking a refund but I guess I won't do it because devs can improve on the story/dialogues for part 2 and 3 and spelling mistakes can be corrected.

But at the present state I do not recommend to buy this game.

PROS:
- The art style is attractive enough and you get what you pay for with a game like this.
- The writing is subpar and there are typos, but the plot is still coherent and easy to follow and the girls talk dirty enough to get your jimmy a rustlin'.

- The soundtrack gets a bad rap, because you're having to listen to the songs on repeat as you click through dialogue. Not sure what everyone expected. On its own, it's a pretty solid compiling of music and worth a listen to.

CONS:
- I feel like the price is a little steep. Ten USD probably would have been more fair, if not lower like five USD.
- While playing, the soundtrack can get pretty repetitive. I'd suggest listening to the tracks as you move through the areas, but muting the music when in a single location for a while. The sound effects are on a separate volume option of the music, thankfully.
- The writing is subpar and there are several typos. I wouldn't mind the plot so much since, as I mentioned earlier, it's just like any other simple harem story, but the typos make me feel like they could have been more thorough with their proofreading.


Overall, I'll recommend it because there are two more Episodes" coming which is going to be a pretty decent extra amount of action. But I HIGHLY recommend that you get the adult/hentai version from a place like MangaGamer before you buy the Steam version.

The game is divided in three parts and at the time of this review only part 1 is released. Part 2 and 3 are included and should be released this year.

There are a lot of visual novels coming on Steam including more and more non-japanese novels. It's hard to find quality amongst all thoses games. I personally try them all because I enjoy the experience and seeing developpers evolve and improve.

You should pick it at a reduced price or at least wait until the whole game is done to see what other people think at that time. Enjoyable VN game. I recommend it to newtime VN players and to veterans who want something shorter before they play their next 40 hr one.
I'll say this first; this game is relatively short. After completing 100%, my steam time says I've played 120 minutes, though I did use the skip feature to miss previously read text. The game also doesn't have voice, being made in Ren'py.
However, the game is very well made, and the art is really nice, although all static images.

There are plenty of branch options leading to the different endings, which help to make you feel like you're Tomo (the protaganist) aiding in your immersion. The choices generally feel like they are doing something worthwhile; only a couple feel like they're there for the sake of it.
There are seven girls to choose from. Each of the characters is interesting, and their personalities are fun, although Nymph could have been fleshed out a little better, though arguably she is only a side character, and a little more history for Minami wouldn't have hurt.

I really recommend this game; it was enjoyable, made me chuckle a few times, and despite the girls having Japanese names, the game doesn't have a tonne of Japanisms, so is accessible to those who aren't as familiar with Japanese culture; this means I can recommend it to all VN players, old and new to the scene alike.

If you are of age, I highly recommend the uncensor patch available at the developer's website; although the game is fine without the adult scenes, its more enjoyable with them. Apart from a little bit of messiness"
